metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（景阳岭站自动气象站-2019）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the Jingyangling station from January 1 to December 31, 2019. The site (101.116° E, 37.838° N) was located on a cold meadow surface in the Jingyangling, Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3750 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity (5 m, north), wind speed and direction (10 m, north), air pressure (in the tamper box on the ground), rain gauge (10 m), four-component radiometer (6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m), and soil moisture profile (-0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m; RH_5 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, and Ts_160 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, and Ms_160 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. Due to the snow cover the solar panel causing insufficient power supply, data during February 3-March 18 were missing; due to the sensor malfunction, there were some NAN invalid values during June 6 to June 20 and June 22 to July 30 of the wind speed and direction; incorrect data of upward shortwave radiation during September to October; (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2019-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) and Che et al. (2019) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2019年1月1日至2019年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网上游景阳岭站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县景阳岭垭口，下垫面是高寒草甸。观测点的经纬度是101.1160E, 37.8384N，海拔3750m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于雪覆盖太阳能板引起供电不足，导致2.3-3.18间数据缺失；由于传感器问题，6.6-6.20、6.22-7.30风速风向出现较多NAN无效值，9-10月四分量向上短波辐射数据出错。（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2019-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)和Che et al. (2019)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.

methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期的气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白，促进高山地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，进而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂雪）现象。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，而这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作），以及2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和风吹（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。每个AMS内的六个层次测量土壤温度和湿度，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell公司）进行测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）由GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell公司）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV公司）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻土观测超级站的冻融过程。这些更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景（如冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学）的科学家发布，预计将作为一个测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how meteorological data is collected in alpine regions despite harsh climate conditions?
Example.QuestionCn: 你能提供一个例子，说明在恶劣气候条件下，如何在高山地区收集气象数据吗？
Example.AnswerEn: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data in alpine regions are collected using an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). These stations monitor variables such as wind speed and direction, air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation.
Example.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，利用观测网络连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）收集无缝的气象和水文数据。这些站点监测的变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水量。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge researchers face when collecting snow cover data in high-altitude regions, and how is it addressed?
Example.QuestionCn: 研究人员在高海拔地区收集积雪数据时面临的一个挑战是什么，以及如何解决这个问题？
Example.AnswerEn: A significant challenge is the influence of strong winds, which can redistribute snow and affect data accuracy. This challenge is addressed by using instruments like FlowCapt to measure blowing (drifting) snow flux at different heights, allowing more precise analysis of snow cover properties.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个显著的挑战是强风的影响，这会重新分配雪并影响数据的准确性。这个挑战通过使用像FlowCapt这样的仪器来测量不同高度的吹雪（漂移雪）通量，从而允许对雪盖特性进行更精确的分析。

Example.AnswerEn: An integrated dataset from the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) combines long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data. It serves as a platform for validating remote sensing products, hydrological model development, and understanding alpine hydrological processes.
Example.AnswerCn: 来自黑河流域上游的综合数据集结合了长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据。它作为验证遥感产品、水文模型开发和理解高山水文过程的平台。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'data collection methods for snow cover properties' in alpine regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: “高山地区雪盖特性的资料收集方法”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Data collection methods for snow cover properties' in alpine regions involve the use of advanced instruments and techniques to measure snow-related variables. These include snow depth, snow water equivalent, albedo, and blowing snow flux, typically collected at specialized snow observation superstations using devices like ultrasonic sensors, GammaMONitors, and FlowCapt sensors to understand snow accumulation and ablation processes.
Definition.AnswerCn: “高山地区雪盖特性的资料收集方法”涉及使用先进的仪器和技术来测量与雪相关的变量。这些变量包括雪深、雪水当量、反照率和吹雪通量，通常在专门的雪观测超级站收集，使用超声波传感器、伽马监测器和流量捕获传感器等设备，以了解雪的积累和融化过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods at the landscape level for the Heihe River Basin compare to those used in the alpine region for snow and frozen ground observations?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的景观层面，数据收集方法与高山地区的雪和冻土观测方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in the Heihe River Basin involve a comprehensive observation network with automatic meteorological stations, snow, and frozen ground superstations, capturing various meteorological and hydrological variables, whereas in the alpine region, the focus is on overcoming challenges like harsh climates and high altitudes with integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks to capture snow and freeze-thaw processes in detail.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河流域的数据收集方法涉及一个综合观测网络，包括自动气象站、雪和冻土超级站，捕捉各种气象和水文变量；而在高山地区，则侧重于克服恶劣气候和高海拔带来的挑战，采用集成、分布式和多尺度的观测网络，以详细捕捉雪和冻融过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in addressing data scarcity challenges between the atmospheric observations in the Qilian Mountains and the integrated observations in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在祁连山的气象观测与黑河上游的综合观测之间，解决数据稀缺挑战的差异是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the Qilian Mountains, the scarcity of observation data is addressed through the deployment of automatic meteorological stations and comprehensive datasets for specific variables like snow cover, while in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin, a more extensive integrated observation network attempts to provide gap-free data to support hydrological modeling and validate remote sensing products.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在祁连山，稀缺的观测数据通过部署自动气象站和针对特定变量（如雪盖）的综合数据集来解决，而在黑河流域的上游，则建立了更为广泛的综合观测网络，旨在提供无缝的数据，以支持水文模型并验证遥感产品。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might variations in soil heat flux data across different depths inform our understanding of soil thermal conductivity in this region?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同深度的土壤热通量数据的变化如何帮助我们理解该地区的土壤导热性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is influenced by factors such as soil density, soil moisture content (including ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature. The observation of soil heat flux at various depths, as mentioned in the data collection methods, allows researchers to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models and understand the dynamic hydrothermal processes within the soil, especially under freeze-thaw cycles.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率受土壤密度、土壤水分含量（包括冻土中的冰含量）和土壤温度等因素的影响。通过在不同深度观察土壤热流，可以帮助研究人员评估高山水文模型的参数化，并理解土壤中动态的水热过程，特别是在冻融循环下。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can remote sensing data be integrated with ground-based observations to improve the prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，以改善对高山地区水文过程的预测？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data, when combined with data assimilation techniques, can enhance the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities and uncertainties in remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions, ground-based observations from integrated networks are crucial for validation and calibration, ultimately improving the predictive understanding of hydrological processes and ecosystem functions in these areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与数据同化技术相结合，可以增强水文过程的预测能力。然而，由于遥感数据在高山地区的复杂性和不确定性，来自综合网络的地面观测对于验证和校准至关重要，最终提高了对这些地区水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, especially regarding hydrological modeling and research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，哪些因素导致观测数据的稀缺，特别是在水文建模和研究方面？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed. These factors hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. Moreover, the scarcity of observation data is exacerbated by difficulties of access and technological barriers.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集。这些因素妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。此外，观测数据的稀缺因获取困难和技术障碍而加剧。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to achieve complete and consistent data collection in alpine regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区实现完整和一致的数据收集具有挑战性？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in achieving complete and consistent data collection in alpine regions arise from the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography. These conditions make it difficult to gather data where and when needed, which also impacts the development of remote sensing technologies and models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，实现完整和一致的数据收集面临的挑战源于寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形。这些条件使得在需要的地方和时间收集数据变得困难，这也影响了遥感技术和模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes errors in the estimation of evapotranspiration in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，蒸散发估算中的误差原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in the estimation of evapotranspiration in such areas are primarily due to the uncertainty in the surface-air temperature difference. This difference might be dominant due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment in these regions contributes to these estimation errors.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在这些地区，蒸散发估算中的误差主要源于地表与空气温度差的的不确定性。由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定地表土壤和植被成分温度的误差，这一差异可能是主导因素。此外，这些地区强烈的平流环境也会导致这些估算误差。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of implementing a distributed and multiscale observation network in high-altitude alpine regions for collecting hydrometeorological data?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在高海拔阿尔卑斯地区实施分布式和多尺度观测网络以收集水文气象数据的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a distributed and multiscale observation network could provide accurate forcing data for hydrological models, validate remote sensing data, and improve the understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. It can also address challenges such as the scarcity of observation data due to harsh climates and technological barriers.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施一个分布式和多尺度的观测网络可以为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的理解。它还可以解决由于恶劣气候和技术障碍导致的观测数据稀缺等挑战。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the consequences of using high-resolution soil physics datasets to capture freeze-thaw processes in alpine hydrology research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率土壤物理数据集来捕捉阿尔卑斯水文研究中的冻融过程可能会产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-resolution soil physics datasets to capture freeze-thaw processes can enhance the parameterization of hydrological models, allow for a better understanding of soil hydrothermal features, and contribute to the study of the dynamic hydrothermal processes within alpine regions. This approach supports the development of more accurate and reliable models for predicting hydrological responses to environmental changes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率土壤物理数据集捕捉冻融过程可以增强水文模型的参数化，帮助更好地理解土壤水热特征，并有助于研究高山地区的动态水热过程。这种方法支持开发更准确和可靠的模型，以预测水文对环境变化的响应。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the primary objectives behind the establishment of a comprehensive observation network in the Heihe River Basin for alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域建立综合观测网络的主要目标是什么，以便进行高山水文学研究？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objectives include providing accurate forcing data for hydrological models, validating remote sensing products, evaluating distributed models, and improving the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions affected by climate change and human activities.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标包括为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感产品，评估分布式模型，以及提高对受气候变化和人类活动影响的高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to address the challenges of data scarcity and technological barriers in alpine regions when developing observation networks and hydrological models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在开发观测网络和水文模型时，解决阿尔卑斯地区数据稀缺和技术障碍的挑战是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Addressing these challenges is crucial for promoting alpine hydrology research, as it enables the collection of consistent high-quality data, supports the development of remote sensing technologies, and facilitates accurate modeling of hydrological processes and their impact on ecosystems and water resource management.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 解决这些挑战对于促进高山水文学研究至关重要，因为这有助于收集一致的高质量数据，支持遥感技术的发展，并促进对水文过程及其对生态系统和水资源管理影响的准确建模。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key procedures involved in setting up an automatic meteorological station for comprehensive data collection in alpine regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山地区建立自动气象站以进行全面数据收集的关键步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The setup involves installing various sensors at specific heights and orientations, such as air temperature and humidity sensors at 5m, wind sensors at 10m, and radiation instruments at 6m. Soil temperature and moisture probes are placed at multiple depths. The stations ensure data quality by marking missing data with placeholders, removing duplicates, and filtering out erroneous data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该设置涉及在特定高度和方向安装各种传感器，例如在5米处安装空气温度和湿度传感器，在10米处安装风速传感器，以及在6米处安装辐射仪器。土壤温度和湿度探头则放置在多个深度。各个站点通过用占位符标记缺失数据、删除重复数据和过滤错误数据来确保数据质量。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can snow cover and frozen ground be effectively monitored in challenging alpine environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在具有挑战性的高山环境中有效监测雪盖和冻土？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Monitoring is achieved through a network of automatic meteorological stations and superstations equipped with instruments like the GMON for snow water equivalent measurement and FlowCapt for blowing snow. These stations collect data on snow depth, soil temperature and moisture, and use sensors to capture freeze-thaw processes in multiple soil layers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 监测是通过一系列自动气象站和超级站实现的，这些站配备了如GMON用于雪水当量测量和FlowCapt用于吹雪的仪器。这些站收集雪深、土壤温度和湿度的数据，并使用传感器捕捉多个土壤层中的冻融过程。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the key technological advancements that have enabled the development of integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，哪些关键技术进步促进了集成、分布式和多尺度观测网络的发展？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The development of integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks in alpine regions is enabled by the use of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs), advanced sensors for snow and frozen ground observations, and wireless sensor networks. These technologies facilitate the collection of high-resolution data on meteorological, snow, and soil conditions despite the challenging environment of alpine regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络的发展得益于自动气象站（AMS）、用于雪和冻土观测的先进传感器以及无线传感器网络的使用。这些技术使得尽管在高山地区环境条件严峻，仍能收集到关于气象、雪和土壤状况的高分辨率数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do state-of-the-art techniques and instruments enable the accurate capture of snow accumulation and ablation processes in alpine hydrology?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 最先进的技术和仪器如何使得在阿尔卑斯水文学中准确捕捉雪积累和融化过程成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: State-of-the-art techniques and instruments, such as the GammaMONitor for measuring snow water equivalent, SR50A for snow depth measurement, and FlowCapt for blowing snow detection, enable accurate capture of snow accumulation and ablation processes. These instruments provide precise measurements required to study the snow dynamics in complex alpine environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 先进的技术和仪器，如用于测量雪水当量的GammaMONitor、用于测量雪深的SR50A以及用于检测吹雪的FlowCapt，使得准确捕捉雪的积累和融化过程成为可能。这些仪器提供了研究复杂高山环境中雪动态所需的精确测量。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or resources are necessary to effectively integrate observation data with remote sensing data for improved hydrological modeling in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 有效整合观测数据与遥感数据以改善高山地区水文模型所需的条件或资源是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: To effectively integrate observation data with remote sensing data for improved hydrological modeling in alpine regions, it is necessary to have comprehensive, high-quality ground-based data collected from AMSs and superstations. These datasets serve as validation tools for remote sensing data and help in the development of precise hydrological models that account for the complex interactions in alpine environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 为了有效地将观测数据与遥感数据结合起来，以改善高山地区的水文模型，有必要收集来自自动气象站（AMS）和超级气象站的全面、高质量的地面数据。这些数据集作为遥感数据的验证工具，并有助于开发精确的水文模型，以考虑高山环境中的复杂相互作用。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when attempting to collect consistent and comprehensive data in high-altitude alpine regions, and how can these challenges affect the accuracy of alpine hydrological models?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高海拔高山地区收集一致和全面的数据时可能会出现哪些挑战，这些挑战如何影响高山水文模型的准确性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. The scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行完整和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。由于获取数据的困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺阻碍了高山水文建模，并促使下一代生态观测网络和实验的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might remote sensing data require validation and calibration when used to predict hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 遥感数据在用于预测高山地区的水文过程时，为什么需要验证和校准？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions, which have to be validated and calibrated. Using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes, but these uncertainties need to be addressed to ensure accuracy.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据中存在各种不确定性来源，特别是在高山地区，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。结合遥感数据和数据同化可以改善水文过程的预测，但必须解决这些不确定性以确保准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected outcomes of integrating observation, simulation, and acquired datasets for understanding alpine hydrology, and why might these outcomes not be fully realized?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以理解高山水文的预期结果是什么，以及这些结果为何可能无法完全实现？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The integration aims to provide accurate forcing data for alpine hydrological models, validate remote sensing data, and allow the evaluation of distributed models to improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. Challenges such as the availability of high-quality snow and frozen ground data for parameterization and the influence of strong winds affecting data collection may hinder the realization of these outcomes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该集成旨在为高山水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并允许评估分布式模型，以提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。高质量的雪和冻土数据的可用性不足，以及强风对数据收集的影响等挑战，可能会妨碍这些成果的实现。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of employing remote sensing data in improving the prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估利用遥感数据提高高山地区水文过程预测的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes, although there are various sources of uncertainties, especially in the alpine region, which need to be validated and calibrated.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与数据同化相结合的使用可以改善水文过程的预测，尽管在阿尔卑斯地区存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your opinion on the challenges faced in collecting consistent and comprehensive data in alpine regions, and how might these challenges impact the development of hydrological models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您对在高山地区收集一致且全面的数据所面临的挑战有何看法，这些挑战可能会如何影响水文模型的开发？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, such as the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit data collection, hindering the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. The scarcity of observation data due to access difficulties and technological barriers has motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，如寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，阻碍了数据收集，妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺促使了下一代生态系统观测网络的发展。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your view, how do the integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks contribute to advancing alpine hydrology research, particularly concerning snow cover and frozen ground observations?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络如何促进高山水文学研究的进展，特别是在雪盖和冻土观测方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation networks provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. These networks capture snow accumulation and ablation processes and freeze-thaw processes, which are crucial for understanding hydrological processes in alpine regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络为水文建模提供了准确的强迫数据，验证了遥感数据，并提高了对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。这些网络捕捉了雪的积累和融化过程以及冻融过程，这对于理解高山地区的水文过程至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure how data collection methods manage to deal with the challenges of harsh climate and high altitudes in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定数据收集方法如何应对高山地区恶劣气候和高海拔的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods in alpine regions involve the use of an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological, snow, and frozen ground observation network. This includes automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, which help in capturing high-resolution soil physics datasets and other meteorological variables despite the cold climate and complex terrain.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集方法涉及使用一个集成的、分布式的多尺度水文气象、雪和冻土观测网络。这包括自动气象站和超级站，用于雪和冻土观测，帮助在寒冷气候和复杂地形中捕获高分辨率的土壤物理数据集和其他气象变量。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data quality is ensured when there are technological barriers and difficulties in accessing remote alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在存在技术障碍和难以进入偏远高山地区的情况下，如何确保数据质量。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data quality in remote alpine regions is ensured through a series of data processing and quality control steps. For instance, the observation network uses state-of-the-art instruments to monitor meteorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data. Additionally, data validation is conducted using remote sensing products, gap-free meteorological data collection, and addressing sensor malfunctions caused by power loss or environmental conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在偏远的高山地区，数据质量通过一系列数据处理和质量控制步骤得以确保。例如，观测网络使用最先进的仪器来监测气象、雪盖和冻土数据。此外，数据验证还使用遥感产品、无间隙的气象数据收集，并解决因电力损失或环境条件导致的传感器故障。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't quite grasp how datasets for snow cover and frozen ground are developed to support hydrological modeling in the Heihe River Basin.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法完全理解如何开发雪盖和冻土的数据集，以支持黑河流域的水文模型。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets for snow cover and frozen ground in the Heihe River Basin are developed through an integrated observation network that includes seven automatic meteorological stations and superstations for capturing snow accumulation and ablation processes. These datasets provide high-quality meteorological data, snow depth and water equivalent measurements, and soil temperature profiles, which are crucial for hydrological models and validating remote sensing products.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域，雪盖和冻土的数据集是通过一个综合观测网络开发的，该网络包括七个自动气象站和超级站，用于捕捉雪的积累和融化过程。这些数据集提供高质量的气象数据、雪深和水当量测量以及土壤温度剖面，这些对于水文模型和验证遥感产品至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the various data collection methods utilized for observing soil temperature and moisture profiles in alpine hydrology research, highlighting any technological innovations that address challenges in the field.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在高山水文学研究中用于观察土壤温度和湿度剖面的各种数据收集方法，强调任何解决该领域挑战的技术创新。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Soil temperature and moisture were measured within several layers at each automatic meteorological station (AMS), with more intensive measurements conducted at the A’rou frozen ground superstation in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m. This setup captures soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). Additionally, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture, addressing the challenges posed by cold climates and high altitudes in alpine regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在每个自动气象站（AMS）内，土壤温度和湿度在多个层次上进行了测量，其中在A’rou冻土超级站进行了更为密集的测量，共在十八个层次上测量至3.2米深。这一设置捕捉了冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化，解决了高寒地区和高海拔地区所带来的挑战。
